Textbook Exchange Network

I designed a logo for a friend's program for facilitating buying and selling of physical textbooks between college students on their respective campuses. I also created posters to advertise the program's semesterly events.

Sketchbook pages of logo designs (Click for full view)

  • time range: June - August 2018
  • client: TCU (Tufts Community Union) Senate
  • tools: Sketch
  • my role: logo designer, graphic designer

I was invited to design this by my friend Phil Miller, a TCU Senator who has been expanding the Textbook Exchange Network Program since our first year at Tufts. I decided to work with arrow and book motifs to symbolize the program's goal of connectivity & accessible exchange between students & between other colleges that have now adopted the program.

Final logo for Textbook Exchange Network; campus poster & Facebook cover to promote program hours

There was a surprisingly wide variety of designs that I played with, drawing inspiration from minimalistic, icon-like designs as well as the aesthetics of business and academic branding. During this process I struggled with breaking out of a visual vocabulary consisting only of linework when using pen and paper, so mocking up multiple designs in Sketch became a crucial step.

Some alternative logo mockups
